name: Onix

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Onix (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, though colored black.

strengths: Exceptional 90 HP for a Basic common Pokemon makes it one of the most durable starters
Harden ability effectively negates most early-game attacks and prevents chip damage
Rock Throw is energy-efficient at just 1 Fighting Energy for 10 damage
Strong against Lightning and Fire Pokemon in the early game
Can wall against multiple common Pokemon that deal 30 or less damage
weaknesses: Grass weakness is significant with popular Grass Pokemon in the format
Very high retreat cost of 3 makes it difficult to switch out
Neither attack deals substantial damage compared to evolved Pokemon
Harden requires prediction and doesn't protect against heavy hitters
No evolution path means it falls off in the late game
synergies: Use Defender to further reduce incoming damage and maximize Harden's effectiveness
Pair with PlusPower to boost Rock Throw's modest damage output
Switch or Scoop Up can help manage the costly retreat when needed
Works well as an opening tank to absorb damage while setting up other Pokemon
counters: Bulbasaur and Grass starters - Double weakness makes Onix vulnerable
Tangela - Poisonpowder bypasses Harden and deals continuous damage
Bellsprout evolutionary line - Grass weakness is exploited
